name: room-me
title: Room.me
skills: SASS, BEM CSS, AngularJS, Ruby On Rails
presentation: Room.me is a German website, which helps people to search the perfect roommate or find the perfect room, corresponding to their personnality or hobbies, in San Francisco. The main features are answering questions about his/her personnality, posting or finding a room and sending or answering messages to other users. In the context of an internship in this start-up, I helped integrating the new pages or main pages modifications (list of rooms in the area, single room, campaigns of communication), and the new features (inbox, slideshow, add a room to favorites) on the website. I worked with SASS with the BEM CSS, and also AngularJS for the front-end. I also had the occasion to use Ruby On Rails, used for the website's back-end.

gallery.title: List of rooms in our area, with the score's matching with its owner(s)
Room's page, with the main informations
Slideshow with the pictures of the room
User's inbox, with his/her applications, received answers, send messages

name: adrian-mannarino
title: Adrian Mannarino
presentation: "adrian-mannarino.com" is the official website of the French tennis player Adrian Mannarino. In the context of the Rolland Garros Cup, it was important to increase its visibility and popularity during this period.Also, my team (7 people) and I designed and developed a website, which present him and his history, will shows his last tournament results and actuality, allows him to publish article and pictures, and people to contact him. A promotionnal campaign on social networks was also launched to promote the launch of the new website. As the Front-end developer in this project, I integrated the responsive website, using Less, jQuery and TweenMax.js.

gallery.title: History of the player, desktop version
History of the player, mobile version
Page of an article, desktop version
Page of an article, mobile version

name: sampleo
title: Sampleo
presentation: "sampleo.com" is a site which proposes to people to test products for free, the only condition being to let a review on it. When I started my internship in the company, the new version of the site had just come out and was only usable on desktop. Also, my main mission was to make it responsive, to increase its number of visites, but also optimized it for mobile devices. I learned to make a site cross-browser and cross-plateform and discovered the Symfony 2 framework, on which the site was developed.

name: geofarming
title: Geofarming
presentation: Geofarming is a project launched by the "Assiette Verte" association. It aims to teach French residents about their local agriculture, through courses using geocaching. My group and I had to develop a site, on which families could see and choose courses they want to participate in. Also, the conception was the most difficult part, asking us to ask questions like : "How to ensure that families will access to our site and will want to use it ? How be sure they would choose a course then try it outside ?". The UX design part took one month, then two developers and I developed the site on AngularJS during two months.

gallery.title: First step in the creation of a course
Second step in the creation of a course
Last step in the creation of a course

name: find-it-out
title: Find-it-out
presentation: Find-it-out is a website to make Parisians discover original places on their way in their everyday life. The site allows them to select several places (street-art, bar, etc.) from a starting point to an arrival point. For this project, I made the wireframes at first and then integrate the website using HTML5, CSS3 and jQuery, making in sort to make it responsive.

gallery.title: Homepage : the user can find and select the places he wants to visit.
Instructions of direction show off once the course determinated.
User's personal informations in a right sidebar.

name: cafe-culturel
title: Café Culturel
presentation: Café Culturel is an association borned in 1998 at Saint Denis, France. It promotes urban culture since, such as hip-hop, rap, graffiti, street-art, through activities for young people, in collaboration with French famous rappers and artists. During my Bachelor's degree, a team of 5 students and I were in charge of build a new website and new tools of communication for the association. My first role as a project manager was to manage the team, ensured the project was going well and make the connection between the association, my team and our project tutor. My second role, as a web developer, was to develop the site on WordPress within one month. This was the first time I developed a website for a client.

name: dear-boutique
title: Dear Boutique
presentation: Dear Boutique is a shop in the center of Paris, who sells jewelries and clothes for women. This is where I made my first internship in 2012. As a webdesigner, I had to recast its site's design and content. I thought at first at the new arborescence, making an audit of the actuel website, then made wireframes. Finally, I redefined the graphic charter and made more than thirty templates.
